question: 領袖
sourceMnemonic:
Someone who has <kanji>territory</kanji> under their <kanji>sleeve</kanji> is the <vocabulary>leader</vocabulary>. They're the <vocabulary>boss</vocabulary> of all this territory because they say so, and because they shoved it all into their big sleeves.

This is a very formal word that is often used in political context, particularly when referring to the leader of a faction or political party.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You've learned them already, so you should be able to read this on your own!
